failures.title: BookingWidget 'Guests' label — CSS class conflict renders near-white text on near-white background
failures.rootCause: Conflicting Tailwind utilities: text-brand-heading (intended) overridden by text-brand-surface (wins)
failures.fix: Remove 'text-brand-surface' from the label className in BookingWidget.tsx

failures.title: Footer section labels at 60% opacity — 3.81:1 on blue background
failures.rootCause: text-brand-bg/60 on dark blue footer. 60% white opacity on #005887 falls below AA threshold for 12px text.
failures.fix: Change text-brand-bg/60 → text-brand-bg/75 (CR 5.03:1) or text-brand-bg/80 (CR 5.52:1, matches description text). Apply same fix to dark:text-brand-text/60.

failures.title: Mobile menu active nav link — yellow on white — 1.47:1
failures.rootCause: text-brand-secondary (#f4d35e yellow) used as active indicator on white mobile menu background. Token designed for use on dark gradient; fails on white.
failures.fix: Use text-brand-primary (#005887 → 7.65:1 on white) for mobile active state, or apply a background highlight approach (bg-brand-primary/10 text-brand-primary).

uniformity.title: BookingWidget label has conflicting CSS class pair text-brand-heading + text-brand-surface
uniformity.finding: Two text-color utilities on the same element. Tailwind v4 last-defined wins. Introduces invisible text (F-01). May indicate stale copy-paste.
uniformity.fix: Remove text-brand-surface from label. Audit BookingWidget for similar class conflicts.

uniformity.title: Active nav indicator token applied inconsistently between desktop (passes) and mobile (fails)
uniformity.finding: text-brand-secondary works on dark gradient (7.48:1) but fails on white mobile menu (1.47:1). Same token, different outcome based on background context.
uniformity.fix: Active state in MobileMenu should define its own context-appropriate color rather than inheriting the same token from the desktop nav.
